answers.answer: Primary Hyperparathyroidism.The PTH is inappropriately normal in the face of hypercalcemia and low 25-OH-D is common in primary HPTH.

question: What is the differential diagnosis for a 79 year old lady with hypercalcemia with a serum calcium of 10.9, an ionized calcium of 6.2 (4.5-5.6), intact PTH of 50 (15-65), vitamin D 25  hydroxy 55 ng/ml, creatinine 0.88, with normal renal function. Chronic problems are diabetes, controlled and essential hypertension which is moderately controlled.  There is no history of kidney stones or stroke or heart attack..
title: high calcium, normal PTH
